properties.title: The Busy Developer's Guide to the NeuClear ID API
properties.author: Pelle Braendgaard

section.name: Introduction
section.p: This document describes in Example form the usage of the NeuClear ID API. The Document is not intended as an implemntation document or a strict API definition. The current final API Specifications can be found in the Project Java Docs.
The main purpose of the NeuClear ID API is to provide a simple framework and API for building applications using a Public Key Infrastructure (PKI).

section.name: Creating an Identity
section.p: All messages (SignedNamedObjects in NeuClear lingo) in NeuClear ID must be signed by an Identity. So to get started we must first create a new Identity.
The easiest way to get started is to use the neuclear-id-uber.jar from a command line. We need to have the following ready:

As we first need to create a top level Identity for your domain we will use the name neu://yourdomain.com as the Identity name. For now to keep things simple lets use your email address as the default receiver.

Now we know the name of our new identity we first need to create our keypair. Sun provides us with a very badly designed tool called keytool which we can use to create and store our keypair. The NeuClear toolset will provide its own keygeneration tools soon, but for now we've got to do it like this:
section.source:
$ keytool -genkey -keyalg RSA -alias neu://yourdomain.com Enter keystore password: ##### What is your first and last name? [Unknown]: neu://yourdomain.com What is the name of your organizational unit? [Unknown]: Your Domain What is the name of your organization? [Unknown]: Your Domain What is the name of your City or Locality? [Unknown]: Panama City What is the name of your State or Province? [Unknown]: Panama What is the two-letter country code for this unit? [Unknown]: PA Is CN=neu://yourdomain.com, OU=Your Domain, O=Your Domain, L=Panama City, ST=Panama, C=PA correct? [no]: yes
Enter key password for <neu://yourdomain.com> (RETURN if same as keystore password):
